content.description:
Fun climb with a technical crux.



Just left of vampire on the primary face of Mt MacDonald far right side.

9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.

The start of this is very interesting and very worth doing. Stem up into a roof with really good hands clipping 2 bolts that protect the roof then pull up and over into a steep hand crack with a hand jam and start plugging pieces. Route follows a flaring crack/gulley all the way up 23m till you move out left into some incredible exposure to a beautiful anchor ledge. 



Just left of the wide cleave in main wall right where the approach trail meets the wall. You can't really miss the 2 bolt crux when you look up from the approach trail.

2 bolts to protect the roof crux then it's standard rack to 2" but take doubles of smaller pieces if you want to stitch. Takes nuts well and I think I only placed a single 2" which wasn't totally necessary. Anchor is 2 bolts with rap rings.

Really fun mixed climb (2 bolts on an unprotected face above a mini roof). All the hands are juggy and the moves are very fun. Great stances for placing pro but can be a bit run out for a new trad leader. You can't really stitch it up. Just go slow and unlock the jugs and steps. The trickiest part of this climb is getting started and getting the first piece set then getting above the pod. After only doing this once I felt like the committing move over the pod was probably 5.9-ish but I likely was doing something unnecessary or off-route (as usual).



In the middle of the main wall. There's a pod (void) in the wall about 5 feet off the ground that is big enough to hold a person and you start under this and climb right and around the pod to start the line. First opportunity for pro is about 12ft off the ground in a crack above and to the right of the pod.

2 bolts on the face, 2 bolt anchor with rap ring.

Excellent first lead route with stunning views. Rated 5.7 in Paul Morris' Vancouver Island South Guidebook 2021.



Far right on main wall near the end.

10 bolts with 2 bolt anchor that includes mussy-style hooks

Very fun route. Steep, slightly overhanging crux in middle of route with bolt before committing and jugs to pull over.



Far right on main wall near the end.

11 bolts with 2 bolt anchor with mussy-style hooks.

Fun route. Great rock with plenty of jugs, great feet and some good exposure.



Far right side on main wall near the end.

9 bolts with 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.

Great route on the sunniest part of the wall. Dries fast and is fairly consistent compared to many climbs in the area. Crux is around the middle of the steep face where you need to be positioned correctly to access a right hand jug to get through the crux.



Middle of the face on the very far right end of the main wall.

10 bolts with mussy hook anchors
Relatively sunny and dries faster than most. Spectacular views.
